env.py
Go to the documentation of this file.
1 #!/usr/bin/env python
2 
3 """
4 
5 See README.md for more info
6 
7 1. Import this script
8 2. Invoke env.buildP()
9 3. Then use P as required
10 4. Invoke env.printP() to print a nice readable format
11 5. When done using P, invoke env.scrubP() to empty it so that it can be rebuilt
12 
13 
14 TERMINATING MODEL (terminal_state == True)
15 Terminating states
16  Reward GOAL_REWARD_POSITIVE for reaching or staying in final arm pose (for the correct action)
17 Pre-terminating states
18  Reward GOAL_REWARD_POSITIVE for reaching the final arm pose (action up)
19 Starting states
20  Reward ACTION_REWARD_POSITIVE for staying or leaving initial arm pose (for the correct action)
21 Other states
22  Reward ACTION_REWARD_POSITIVE for action matching force, else ACTION_REWARD_NEGATIVE
23 
24 NON-TERMINATING MODEL (terminal_state == False)
25 Final arm pose states
26  Reward ACTION_REWARD_POSITIVE for staying (action up or stay) in or leaving final arm pose (action down)
27 Initial arm state
28  Reward ACTION_REWARD_POSITIVE for staying in (action down or stay) or leaving initial arm pose (action up)
29 Other states
30  Reward ACTION_REWARD_POSITIVE for action matching force, else ACTION_REWARD_NEGATIVE
31 """
32 
33 import numpy as np
34 import pandas as pd
35 
36 nS = 30
37 nA = 3
38 
39 ACTION_DOWN = 0
40 ACTION_STAY = 1
41 ACTION_UP = 2
42 
43 FORCE_SAYS_DOWN = 0
44 FORCE_SAYS_STAY = 1
45 FORCE_SAYS_UP = 2
46 
47 ACTION_REWARD_POSITIVE = -1
48 ACTION_REWARD_NEGATIVE = -3
49 GOAL_REWARD_POSITIVE = 10
50 
51 
52 TERMINAL_STATES=[nS-1, nS-2, nS-3]
53 
54 P = {s : {a : [] for a in range(nA)} for s in range(nS)}
55 
56 # Need to build the model when invoking this script in others before using it.
57 # @param terminal_state. If the model is terminating or non terminating type.
58 def buildP(terminal_state=False):
59  global P
60  for s in range(nS):
61  for a in range(nA):
62  force = s%3
63  arm = int(s/3)
64  s_=r1=r2=r3=1
65  #General cases
66 
67  if (force == FORCE_SAYS_DOWN and a == ACTION_DOWN) \
68  or (force == FORCE_SAYS_STAY and a == ACTION_STAY) \
69  or (force == FORCE_SAYS_UP and a == ACTION_UP):
70  r = ACTION_REWARD_POSITIVE
71  else:
72  r = ACTION_REWARD_NEGATIVE
73 
74  if (a == ACTION_UP):
75  s_ = (s - force) + 3
76  elif (a == ACTION_STAY):
77  s_ = s - force
78  else:
79  s_ = (s - force) - 3
80 
81 
82  #Border cases
83 
84  #Arm in lowest poistion
85  if (arm == 0):
86  s_ = 0 if (a == ACTION_DOWN or a == ACTION_STAY) else 3
87  # r = ACTION_REWARD_POSITIVE if a == DO_NOTHING else ACTION_REWARD_NEGATIVE
88  if (s == 0 and a == ACTION_STAY) or (s == 1 and a == ACTION_STAY) or (s == 2 and a == ACTION_UP) :
89  r = ACTION_REWARD_POSITIVE
90  else:
91  r = ACTION_REWARD_NEGATIVE
92 
93  #Arm in final position
94  if (arm == int((nS/3))-1):
95  if (a == ACTION_UP):
96  s_ = s - force
97  elif (a == ACTION_STAY):
98  s_ = s - force
99  else:
100  s_ = (s - force) - 3
101 
102  if terminal_state:
103  r = GOAL_REWARD_POSITIVE if a == ACTION_STAY else ACTION_REWARD_NEGATIVE
104  else:
105  if(s == nS-3 and a == ACTION_DOWN) or ( (s == nS-1 or s == nS-2) and a == ACTION_STAY ) :
106  r = ACTION_REWARD_POSITIVE
107  else:
108  r = ACTION_REWARD_NEGATIVE
109 
110 
111  r1 = r2 = r3 = r
112 
113  # Arm in penultimate position and input to go up
114  if (arm == int((nS/3))-2 and force == FORCE_SAYS_UP and terminal_state):
115  if s_ in TERMINAL_STATES: r1 = GOAL_REWARD_POSITIVE
116  if s_+1 in TERMINAL_STATES: r2 = GOAL_REWARD_POSITIVE
117  if s_+2 in TERMINAL_STATES: r3 = GOAL_REWARD_POSITIVE
118 
119  P[s][a].append( (1.0/3.0, s_, r1, True if (s_ in TERMINAL_STATES or s in TERMINAL_STATES) and terminal_state else False) )
120  P[s][a].append( (1.0/3.0, s_+1, r2, True if (s_+1 in TERMINAL_STATES or s in TERMINAL_STATES) and terminal_state else False) )
121  P[s][a].append( (1.0/3.0, s_+2, r3, True if (s_+2 in TERMINAL_STATES or s in TERMINAL_STATES) and terminal_state else False) )
122 
123 # Since model is built explicitly, successive buildP() calls keep stacking the arrays in size. scrubP() before each buildP() ensures the model size remains constant.
124 def scrubP():
125  global P
126  P = {s : {a : [] for a in range(nA)} for s in range(nS)}
127 
128 # Nice readable format
129 def printP():
130  for s in range(nS):
131  for a in P[s]:
132  force = s%3
133  arm = int(s/3)
134  for x in P[s][a]:
135  print("s:",s,
136  " a:", "UP" if a == ACTION_UP else ("DOWN" if a == ACTION_DOWN else "STAY") ,
137  " :", x,
138  "Force :", "UP" if force==FORCE_SAYS_UP else ("DOWN" if force==FORCE_SAYS_DOWN else "STAY") ,
139  "Arm : ", arm)
140  print()
141  print("----------------------")
142 
143 # Save model to text file
144 def printPtoTxtFile(path):
145  for s in range(nS):
146  for a in P[s]:
147  force = s%3
148  arm = int(s/3)
149  for x in P[s][a]:
150  print("s:",s,
151  " a:", "UP" if a == ACTION_UP else ("DOWN" if a == ACTION_DOWN else "STAY") ,
152  " :", x,
153  "Force :", "UP" if force==FORCE_SAYS_UP else ("DOWN" if force==FORCE_SAYS_DOWN else "STAY") ,
154  "Arm : ", arm, open(path,"a"))
155  print(" ", open(path,"a"))
156  print("----------------------", open(path,"a"))
